Title: Evaluating New Marketing Tools
Content: When considering new marketing tools, it is essential to evaluate their effectiveness and reliability. For instance, a tool like 'Peach Blossom Island' on Taobao claims to help merchants reach targeted fans by charging a fee. However, the success of such tools heavily depends on the quality of the content you produce and its ability to attract and engage fans. Before investing in such tools, ensure that your content strategy on platforms like Xiaohongshu or Douyin is already effective. These platforms contribute significantly to traffic on Taobao and Tmall. If your content is not converting well on these platforms, it is unlikely that the tool will bring significant sales. Therefore, focus on refining your content and engagement strategies on popular social media platforms before spending money on new marketing tools.

Title: Using Keyword Analysis for Better Reach
Content: Keyword analysis is a crucial aspect of improving your content's reach and visibility. Tools like 'Juguang' can help you analyze the performance of specific keywords, including their search volume and competition. By understanding which keywords are popular and relevant to your niche, you can optimize your content to rank higher in search results. For example, if you are in the dairy product industry, analyzing keywords like 'milk powder' or 'yogurt' can help you identify which terms have higher search volumes and lower competition. This information allows you to create content that targets these keywords, increasing the likelihood of attracting more traffic. Additionally, using tools like 'Cucumber' can provide insights into the interaction rates of different keywords, helping you refine your content strategy further.

Title: The Importance of Multiple Accounts for Brands
Content: For brands, managing multiple accounts can be a strategic move to enhance reach and mitigate risks. Having multiple accounts allows you to diversify your content and target different audience segments more effectively. For example, one account can focus on brand-building content, while another can be dedicated to promotional and sales-driven posts. This approach not only helps in reaching a broader audience but also reduces the risk associated with relying on a single account. If one account underperforms or faces issues, the other accounts can continue to drive engagement and sales. Additionally, multiple accounts enable you to experiment with different content styles and strategies, providing valuable insights into what works best for your brand. By leveraging multiple accounts, you can create a more robust and resilient brand presence online.
